body_html: I think the approach here is to add a new native function. You can declare it in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/native_functions.yaml and then write the function body in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Indexing.cpp . Indexing a sparse tensor is probably just searching through tensor._indices() for the desired indices and returning a new tensor with those indices and their corresponding values.

body: I think the approach here is to add a new native function. You can declare it in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/native_functions.yaml and then write the function body in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Indexing.cpp . Indexing a sparse tensor is probably just searching through `tensor._indices()` for the desired indices and returning a new tensor with those indices and their corresponding values.
